Posts.Content: Jul 13, 2011 08:28PM NBG wrote: I was just diagnosed two weeks ago tomorrow and know exactly what you are going through.  I echo what everyone said about bringing a notebook with you and having someone else take the notes for you.  My husband and I were both useless.  My mother and father also came (I am only 27) and my mom is our official note taker.  These last two weeks have been very hard with running to different doctors, doing follow-up tests, etc.  But I have to say that today we chose our oncologist and have a plan in place to start chemo on Tuesday and I am already feeling much calmer.  It is incredible how resiliant the human body can be.  What I think was the most helpful this for us, was going away the weekend I was diagnosed.  I was diagnosed late on Thursday afternoon of the 4th of July weekend.  We just went away for the weekend.  We definitely cried, but we also laughed a lot, drank a lot, and saw that while things will be really hard for a while we can also be normal.  We came back from the weekend in a much better place emotionally.
